newsitem.title: SPAIN: Argentina weighing Brady buyback options - Kiguel.
newsitem.headline: Argentina weighing Brady buyback options - Kiguel.

text.p: Undersecretary of Finance Miguel Kiguel said on Monday Argentina was weighing its Brady buyback options.

"We are analysing our options on a continuous basis. Once we feel comfortable with the business of a buyback and find the mechanism which is good for the country then we might go out in terms of doing a buyback," Kiguel told journalists before the start of the annual meeting of the Inter-American Development Bank.

In an interview with Reuters at the Inter-American Development Bank's annual meeting, Kiguel said Argentina was less interested in the route Mexico took last year, when it exchanged Brady debt for new Mexican paper but exposed itself to market volatility during a two-week period during the process.
"Based on that experience we are looking for other ways of doing a buy back," he said, adding Argentina was considering other methods in addition to a straight buy back.

"One thing could be an auction where you issue a new bond and instead of having a tender offer you auction new bonds in exchange for old bonds," he said. "But again, that's just on the drawing board."
Asked whether Argentina wanted to take this step during 1997, he said: "If we can we would do something this year." --Barcelona Newsroom +34 3 424 2659
